RADIO STATIONS
AM
64O KILOCYCLES
FM
go.g MEGACYCLES
THE UNIVERSITY OF OKLAHOMA
NORMAN• OKLAHOMA
October 10, 1952
Mr. Graydon Ausmus, Director
Radio Broadcasting Services
University of Alabama
Box 2002
University, Alabama
Dear Graydon:
While I was in Urbana working on the NAEB-FAE Grants, Jim told me
that the committee was very seriously considering Earl Wynn for
the position of executive director. What little I know of Earl and some of
the few contacts that I have had with him, he impresses me as being
a pretty solid individual. I had thought of him in connection with
the position but quickly dismissed it when I felt that he had
undoubtedly too good a position there at North Carolina. I do hope
that you will find all of his references satisfactory for I certainly
would be heartily in favor of Earlls appointment to the position.
I trust by now that you have received the Memorandum which Cousin
Parker sent out through Cousin Burton. Incidentally, I hope that
you chastize him for not dating the memo. This does not please
me in the least and I shall and will speak vigorously against it
for I do not think that it takes care of the existing problem one
bit. I think it is a very half-hearted and namby-pamby attempt
to solve a pressing problem. I am taking along plenty of money
to Minneapolis so I can bail myself out of jail in case I talk
too much with the gentleman from New York. Of course, I don’t
take Si to seriously but it is a funny thing to me that he has to
jump on everybody in the organization from time to time in an
attempt to swing the ”big stick”. The fact that he has gone to
Europe and is in New York doesn’t impress me in the least. So
I believe there will be some very warm sessions in the pre-con¬
vention clam bake. See you then.
Cordially yours.
John W. Dunn, Director
Educational Broadcasting Services
JWD/bg
